quest.name: Shovel or Boogie
journal:
 Quest Sync
Rhil Ril has stumbled upon something rather intriguing.
objectives: Use the rusty spade to dig at the designated location.
Deliver the rotted chest to Rhil Ril and return his rusty spade.

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: You must be a traveler, yes? Then maybe you can help me.

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: I was looking around an abandoned house and I found a map of Amh Araeng, with a big cross drawn on it. It can only mean one thing─treasure!

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: I want to go and look for it, but I have to stay here and guard the village. Could you go in my stead?

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: If there are any shinies to be had, we can share them, yes? Here, take my spade and dig where the cross is!

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: Be sure to bring the treasure to me, along with my spade! You do not want to know what happens to thieves around here...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You discover a rotted chest buried in the soil.

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: Show me what you found! Show me! And give me my spade back, please!

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: Oh, this must be very old... Let us see what is inside...

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: What!? Nothing but junk! Rusty junk, at that! Why would anyone bury this? Wait, is that a diary? I am sure the former owner will not mind if I take a peek...

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: Hmm... It looks like the owner had to leave Amh Araeng but was planning to come back one day.

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: And if that day ever came, they wanted to dig up the diary and continue writing their life story.

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: I wonder if that person is still alive... Probably not, judging by the state of this chest. It must have been buried for a long time. Maybe their children, or their children's children will come in search of it.

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: If I read the rest, maybe I can learn who this person was... And then I will put it back, in a more sturdy box. And since there was no treasure to share, I will give you this instead as payment for your hard work!
